metadata.Title: CVE-2013-6954 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: The png_do_expand_palette function in libpng before 1.6.8 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via (1) a PLTE chunk of zero bytes or (2) a NULL palette, related to pngrtran.c and pngset.c.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> vulnerable code introduced in 1.6.1. In 1.2.x, png_ptr->palette is always set in png_set_PLTE() in pngset.c. jdstrand> openjdk uses system png

criterions.comment: openjdk-7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
